intro: Arrojadoa aureispina, commonly known as the golden spined arrojadoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers and spiny, woody stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Arrojadoa aureispina is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
